Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that if someone has affordable coverage in their workplace, they are not eligible to go into the marketplace, which is not entirely accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to back up its assertion.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the Department of Health and Human Services, stating that individuals with employer insurance can sign up for the online marketplaces but may not find it financially beneficial to do so.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that individuals with employer insurance can still sign up for marketplace coverage, as clarified by the Department of Health and Human Services.
Understate: The claim may be understating the complexity and nuances of the eligibility criteria for marketplace coverage.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misinterpreting or misrepresenting the eligibility rules for marketplace coverage.
Exaggerate: There is no clear evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
